The abilities of the S. cyclophylla extracts to chelate ferrous (Fe 2+) ions were determined by the method described in the literature [ 66] with certain modifications. S. cyclophylla extracts (1 mL, 10–0.312 mg/mL) in methanol were vortexed and incubated for 10 min with 100 µL of ferrous chloride (1 mM) before adding 200 µL of 5 nM ferrozine. The mixtures were incubated for 5 min, and reduction in the violet color of the Fe 2+-complex with ferrozine compared to a blank were determined spectrophotometrically at 562 nm by a UV–Vis spectrophotometer.
